body_content.explanation: a cluster (= group) of small flowers on short spreading stems that come from the same point and form a shape similar to an open umbrella:
examples: The flowers are small, greenish-white, and clustered in large rounded umbels.
The elder tree blossoms with huge umbels of starry white flowers.

body_content.explanation: a type of plant with hollow stems and flowers that grow in umbels:
examples: Common umbels with edible roots include carrots, celery, celery root (celeriac), and parsley.
